text:
Teddi Mellencamp gives update about her deadly cancer tumors
Teddi Mellencamp shares hopeful update about her stage 4 cancer tumors have shrunk or vanished.
Teddi Mellencamp is sharing hope and progress in her battle with cancer, revealing that her tumors have either shrunk or disappeared.
The 43-year-old Real Housewives of Beverly Hills alum posted an emotional health update Tuesday on Instagram, telling fans that recent scans brought “really exciting news.”
“Honestly, the crying is already done,” Mellencamp said in a video.
“I just finished with all of my scans and my tumors have significantly shrunk, which doctors believe means that this all will work and that I will be back to myself and feeling good.”
Mellencamp first revealed in February that her stage 4 melanoma had spread to her lungs and brain.
Despite the seriousness of the diagnosis, doctors initially gave her a 50% chance of survival, she said she's been trying to stay optimistic.
“I’m going to keep a positive outlook because that’s the way my doctor just spoke to me,” she said.
“‘You got that Mellencamp blood, so you’re good.’”
She said she has two more rounds of immunotherapy left. “Hopefully, I am done and I will be cancer-free,” she added.

Mellencamp, who shares three children - Slate, Cruz, and Dove - with her husband, Edwin Arroyave, said the experience has challenged her in ways she never expected.
“I really like to have control, and this is completely out of my control,” she said. “And for the first time, I’m really scared.”
In the caption of her post, Mellencamp detailed the latest test results.
“All tumors stage 4 (metastasized melanoma in my brain and lungs) shrunk or disappeared so I have 6ish more weeks of immunotherapy and doctors believe I will be healed if everything stays on course.”
She closed with a heartfelt thank you.
“Thank you to everyone who has sent their love, prayers, and positivity.”
